channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Young woman makes out with her own FATHER for $1,000 on live radio
item.description: A young woman passionately kissed her own father in a live breakfast radio segment on Friday.

item.title: Women are better than men at coping with shift work because 'their body clocks are set differently'
item.description: Women are more resilient to disruptions in circadian rhythms - making them better suited to shift work and less susceptible to jet lag when travelling around the world.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: It's not just the airlines - UK plc is in a tailspin as well
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: New BBC director-general Tim Davie might have overturned the ban on singing patriotic songs at the Proms. Yet what's the when the country is still cowering in its shell?

item.title: Business leaders warn PM economy will nosedive until coronavirus testing is brought in at borders
item.description: Demanding urgent action from Boris Johnson, business leaders have warned that the 14-day quarantine is crippling travel, wrecking trade prospects and jeopardising economic recovery.

item.title: Four ministries at war: JASON GROVES examines the inside story of the UK's quarantine rules
item.description: JASON GROVES: The controversial quarantine policy has been marred by inconsistencies and Whitehall infighting since it began. The policy may have wrecked thousands of family holidays.

item.title: You can win a house, but are raffle homes the real deal?
item.description: The odds are unlikely but it's not impossible, as 27-year-old Niomi Boontam will tell you. She now owns a London apartment valued at £500,000 after winning a raffle. Her ticket cost just £5.

item.title: VW reveals its smallest campervan yet with a pull-out micro kitchen
item.description: The Caddy California, revealed by the German car manufacturer this week, is designed for holidaying couples, featuring just the one double bed that folds out over the rear seats.

item.title: Shocking moment 'bully' police officer PEPPER SPRAYS rail passenger for resisting arrest
item.description: The shocking footage shows the clash between then passenger and the lone officer after the man refused to wear a face covering on the Wirral line service at Lime Street Station in Liverpool.

item.title: Homeowner transforms avocado bathroom to modern masterpiece for £300
item.description: Neil Painter, 36, and wife Katie, 32, from Marston Green, Birmingham, bought a new home at the upper limit of their budget, but didn't want to live with the outdated decor while saving for renovations.

item.title: Animal charity offers reward to trace the yob who painted a dog to look like a tiger in Malaysia
item.description: A reward is being offered by a Malaysian animal rights group to trace the yob who painted a dog with orange and black stripes so that it resembled a tiger. The public is being asked to help.

item.title: Adventure-loving couple pose for wedding photos on the edge of a CLIFF
item.description: Ryan, 30, and Skye Myers, 28, from Mountain Home, Arkansas, wanted a big ceremony but had to change their plans due to coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: FTSE 100 is worth more than Apple again after it plunged 8%
item.description: Apple dropped 8 per cent or $10 (£7.52) to close at $120.88 (£90.95) in New York yesterday, while the FTSE 100 finished fell 1.5 per cent, or 90 points, to 5851 in London yesterday.

item.title: Pensioner, 84, is forced to lie on a pavement for FIVE HOURS waiting for an ambulance
item.description: Donavon Marsh spent hours on the ground with a blanket covering him after suffering a fall in Waunarlwydd, Swansea at around 4pm on Tuesday.

item.title: New Zealand records its first Covid-19 death since May 24, taking country's death toll to 23
item.description: The man was part of a second-wave cluster of infections that emerged in Auckland last month, according to health officials.

item.title: North Korean defector describes eating insects and seeing 'bodies on the street'
item.description: Yeonmi Park said cold, darkness and starvation were part of everyday life in North Korea and blamed the regime's nuclear ambitions for wrecking the country's economy.

item.title: Bride-to-be's mum says she 'can't afford to put any weight on' in Say Yes To The Dress Lancashire
item.description: In tonight's episode of TLC's Say Yes To The Dress Lancashire, bride-to-be Gemma is taken aback by her outspoken mum Sue - who slams one of the 'clingy' dresses she tries on.'

item.title: Diarrhoea, vomiting and stomach cramps 'should be official symptoms of coronavirus in children'
item.description: Researchers at Queen's University Belfast in Northern Ireland found that the detection rate of children with coronavirus rose from 76 per cent to 97 when stomach problems were included.

item.title: Boris Johnson pressured to drop plans to give former Australia PM Tony Abbott a Brexit trade role
item.description: Former Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott admitted this week to having 'discussions with members of the British government' but stressed 'there is nothing official as yet'.

item.title: Antifa protester linked to shooting death of Patriot Prayer supporter is killed by US Marshals
item.description: An Antifa protester suspected in the shooting death of a supporter of the right-wing group Patriot Prayer in Portland, Oregon has died as police tried to arrest him.

item.title: Haulage and logistics bosses demand 'urgent meeting' with ministers
item.description: The claims were made by organisations including the Road Haulage Association in an open letter to Cabinet Office Minister Michael Gove and Chancellor Rishi Sunak.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing completes the 2020 line-up with 21-year-old singer and YouTube star HRVY
item.description: The 21-year-old is a singer and CBBC presenter, with an album set to be released this November, and is 11th star to be unveiled as a participant on the BBC ballroom show.

item.title: Eight in 10 claims for asylum are rejected... but just 185 migrants have been returned since 2018
item.description: Around 2,500 of this year's 5,500 arrivals have had their claims assessed yet only 20 per cent were successful. It means roughly 2,000 should be deported but very few have been.

item.title: JAN MOIR: Has Gary Lineker scored an asylum own goal?
item.description: JAN MOIR: Gary Lineker has invited a refugee to move into his mansion in Barnes, on the lush, south-western fringes of London, however, will this act of generosity cause more problems than it solves.

item.title: Rebecca Adlington announces she is pregnant with her second child
item.description: Olympic swimmer Rebecca Adlington is expecting her second child.

item.title: Pfizer expects results from its coronavirus vaccine trials by October, CEO confirms
item.description: Pfizer Inc has enrolled 23,000 people in phase III of its coronavirus vaccine trial, which began in July, and says it plans to apply for approval immediately if data shows the jab is safe and effective.

item.title: Brits vent fury as Portugal and Greece stay ON the quarantine-free list despite days of speculation
item.description: It comes after Wales and Scotland imposed their own quarantine rules on Portugal, Nicola Sturgeon also mandating 14-day isolation for arrivals from Greece and Wales adding six Greek islands to its list.

item.title: Human bones found in Suffolk river are NOT remains of RAF gunner Corrie McKeague
item.description: Nicola Urquhart said she had been 'trying to keep a sensible head on' while police were unable to reassure her that human remains found in the River Stour in Sudbury last week were not her son's.

item.title: As Putin's rival fights for life after novichok attack, new book asks why West won't confront Russia
item.description: Not content with sentencing his political opponents to death, Josef Stalin inflicted a particularly cruel end on those awaiting execution in Lubyanka, the notorious Moscow jail.

item.title: England men's and women's teams have received equal pay since January
item.description: The FA have disclosed that England's men's and women's internationals now receive equal pay, following in the footsteps of the likes of Brazil, Australia, New Zealand, and Norway.

item.title: On second thought! Hilarious photos capture the perfectly timed snaps that trick the eyes
item.description: Shareably rounded up a selection of the funniest optical illusion images from around the world that have been shared on social media because they deceive the eyes on first glance.

item.title: Seven schools in England send pupils home to self-isolate due to students catching Covid
item.description: Primary and secondary schools in Greater Manchester, Yorkshire, Leicestershire, Lancashire and Buckinghamshire have all been stricken by the virus.

item.title: Countryside Alliance say BBC should drop outspoken wildlife presenter Chris Packham
item.description: BBC boss Tim Davie should sack the Springwatch presenter (pictured) to 'follow through' with his call for impartiality online, Tim Bonner said.

item.title: Woman who glued her vagina as part of bizarre bid to frame her ex-boyfriend is jailed for ten years
item.description: Vanesa Gesto accused former boyfriend Ivan Rico of kidnapping her outside her home in Bembimbre, Spain, and abandoning her semi-naked after squeezing the superglue into her private parts.

item.title: Renter was forced to move out of property when landlord REFUSED to get rid of mould in his flat
item.description: Jacques Lachetta, from Manchester, took to Twitter to reveal how his landlord refused to get rid of the copious mould in his flat, and claimed residue on his hat was the 'acid wash effect' of the garment.

item.title: Steven Spielberg's adult film star daughter's domestic violence case is DISMISSED
item.description: The domestic violence case against Mikaela Spielberg, the adopted daughter of Steven Spielberg, were dropped this month in Nashville, Tennessee. She was first arrested in February.

item.title: George Washington University professor says she lied about being black
item.description: Jessica Krug, an African history associate professor at George Washington University, revealed on Thursday that she has falsely claimed to be black throughout her career.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 1,735 new cases in biggest surge since 4 June
item.description: The last time daily infections were higher was on June 4, when 1,805 were diagnosed with the disease and the majority of tough lockdown restrictions were still in force.

item.title: Is #MeToo Mulan worth the moolah? BRIAN VINER reviews Disney's £150m remake
item.description: BRIAN VINER: Mulan was meant to be one of the two summer blockbusters, along with Christopher Nolan's Tenet, to breathe fire back into the wounded dragon that is the cinema industry. So much for that.

item.title: Relationship expert reveals what your mobile phone habits say about YOU
item.description: Speaking exclusively to FEMAIL, UK-based relationship Neil Wilkie has revealed what your texting habits say about you. Amongst the categories are the guaranteed and intermittent repliers.

item.title: Britons tucked into 100 MILLION Eat Out to Help Out meals in August
item.description: The 'Eat Out to Help Out' scheme from Chancellor Rishi Sunak has cost the taxpayer £522million to date and the final bill could well top £600million when all the claims are in.

item.title: Netflix will screen controversial 'Diana' the musical that features the Queen labelling her a 'TART'
item.description: Netflix will screen the controversial musical, named 'Diana: A New Musical', which features a fictitious scene where the Queen labels her a 'tart'.

item.title: Donald Trump blasts military sources who claimed he called American WWI dead 'losers' and 'suckers
item.description: Trump vehemently denied the claims, which were first reported in the Atlantic , that he referred to the American war dead at the Aisne-Marne American Cemetery in France in 2018 as 'losers'.

item.title: 'Mother Theresa of Manchester' will move one stop closer to sainthood
item.description: Elizabeth Prout, who died in 1864, has passed the first two stages of sainthood. Her case is being promoted by the Bishop of Shrewsbury, Mark Davies, left

item.title: Are your portions out of control?
item.description: According to a new study by PoundToy, recommended UK portion sizes are much smaller than you might think. For instance, you should only consume half of a 500ml bottle of Coke.

item.title: Boy, 11, 'witnessed his mother kill his five brothers and sisters' in Germany
item.description: Christiane K, 27, is suspected of poisoning the five children whose bodies were discovered at an apartment block in Solingen on Thursday.

item.title: Royal officials 'will examine Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's $150m Netflix deal'
item.description: A palace source claimed that despite ditching official duties any profit-oriented plans would be 'subject to discussion'. Pictured: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

item.title: Anti-lockdown protest leader James Bartolo is dramatically arrested at his Melbourne home
item.description: Coronavirus conspiracy leader James Bartolo was detained at his Melbourne home on Friday morning after four policemen knocked down his door when he refused to open it.

item.title: Charles Dance displays youthful physique shares a kiss with a younger female companion in Venice
item.description: The Game Of Thrones star, 73, showcased his impressive shirtless physique as he shared a kiss with his younger companion during a swim in the ocean.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: On David Blaine's balloon stunt and Lawnchair Larry
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Magician David Blaine, flew above the Arizona desert attached to helium balloons before floating back down to earth on a parachute near Page.

item.title: Frightening moment car plows through a crowd of Black Lives Matter supporters in Times Square
item.description: An unidentified driver was caught on camera driving through a crowd of Black Lives Matter supporters in New York City on Thursday. People were protesting the death of Daniel Prude.

item.title: TOM LEONARD: The ex-vacuum salesman who sucked up the Sussexes
item.description: TOM LEONARD: Netflix is now worth some $187 billion and - with 193 million subscribers in 190 countries - is one of the most valuable entertainment companies in the world.

item.title: Tommy Hilfiger lists flamboyant Miami oceanfront mansion with boldly colorful interiors for $24.5M
item.description: The beachfront estate, that comprises a main residence plus two guest apartments, spans approximately 15,000 square feet and boasts a total of seven bedrooms and 10 bathrooms.

item.title: Trump tells crowd to wear a mask around other people despite not wearing one himself during rally
item.description: The rally at Arnold Palmer Regional Airport comes as Trump's campaign is claiming new signs of momentum in the longtime Democratic stronghold that Trump won by less than 45k votes in 2016.

item.title: Dr. Dre's estranged wife Nicole Young wants $2M monthly amid couple's billion dollar divorce
item.description: Young, 50, has asked a Los Angeles court for temporary spousal support in the amount of $1,936,399, and also wants the mogul, 55, to pay her $5 million in fees she's spent on their split.

item.title: Interactive map shows where next coronavirus hotspots are likeliest to flare up in next three weeks
item.description: The Imperial College London document highlights areas across England and Wales where infections are increasing.

item.title: Jaguar Land Rover is hit by Covid outbreak as four workers test positive
item.description: The affected workers at the company's Solihull plant are all believed to have worked in the paint shop. Anyone who has had close contact with them has been told to self-isolate at home.

item.title: 'Jilted' boy 'made up affair with married teacher to win back his ex-girlfriend's attention'
item.description: Counsel defending Kandice Barber, from Buckinghamshire, alleged the boy had invented a police interview in January last year as a conversation starter with his former partner.

item.title: London 'freezer killer', 36, is found guilty of double murder
item.description: Zahid Younis, 36, has been found guilty of murdering Henriett Szucs, 34, and Mihrican 'Jan' Mustafa, 38, whose bodies were found inside a freezer in his flat in Canning Town, East London.

item.title: 'Johnny Depp is no wife beater' says actor Mark Rylance as his co-star awaits verdict in libel trial
item.description: Oscar-winner Sir Mark, 60, said that the accusations made by Amber Heard against Johnny Depp were not consistent with the Pirates of the Caribbean star's 'character.'

item.title: Seven-figure book deal for debut author, a 21-year-old student
item.description: Aberdeen University student Faridah Abike-Iyimide's debut novel, Ace Of Spades, releases next June. The 21-year-old's book is set in an elite private school, and deals with institutional racism.

item.title: Vanessa Kirby talks to BAZ BAMIGBOYE about her emotional first lead role
item.description: BAZ BAMIGBOYE: The actress - along with screen husband Shia LaBeouf and director Kornel Mundruczo - wanted the birth scenes early on in the film to be as authentic as possible.

item.title: How coronavirus hijacks the body and 'opens the floodgates' for mass infection
item.description: Scientists in Tennessee analysed the genetics of the virus and found it appears to be able to force the body to make more of the receptors the virus uses to enter the body, allowing worse infection.

item.title: Losing weight slashes risk of several chronic health conditions... even if you are still obese
item.description: A major study of more than half a million overweight British adults found going on a diet has significant health benefits, like losing 13 per cent of your body weight cuts chance of type 2 diabetes by 42 per cent.

item.title: 400 people per day died in UK's care homes at peak of Covid crisis
item.description: Fatalities breached this level for 11 days in a row in care homes in the UK in mid-April after spiking by five-fold at the start of the month, according to analysis by the PA news agency.

item.title: How to prevent crying when you cut onions: Home cooks share their fool-proof tricks
item.description: Home cooks have revealed their best tricks for preventing tears when you're cutting an onion, from using a $65 piece of equipment to freezing the vegetable for an hour.

item.title: How THIRTY countries offer airport coronavirus testing to travellers can cut length of quarantine
item.description: There are at least 30 countries which offer or accept coronavirus tests at airports, where a negative test can either end the need for a person to quarantine, or reduce the length of the quarantine.

item.title: Antiobiotics in our waterways puts millions in danger by increasing resistance to the drugs,
item.description: High levels of antibiotics in rivers are putting millions of lives at risk by increasing bacterial resistance to the drugs, research suggests. NHS advice says resistance can create 'superbugs'.

item.title: Pret a Manger offers 'all you can drink' season tickets for £20 a month
item.description: Pret a Manger customers can sign up to a £20 monthly subscription to have up to five drinks a day. The YourPret Barista scheme is part of the chain's radical remodelling to fit the 'new normal'.

item.title: Boris Johnson hails controversial rail link as engine for jobs growth as construction starts at last
item.description: Given the go-ahead on January 10, 2012, Europe's largest infrastructure project will today move from enabling works to full construction - with shovels finally going in the ground.

item.title: Private pension age rise to 57: Hopes of early retirement dashed as ministers raise minimum age
item.description: It means those currently aged 47 and under will not be able to access any of the money they have saved into pensions for an extra two years. This does not affect when the state pension can be claimed.

item.title: Study finds 60% higher rates of COVID-19 among people with low levels of the 'sunshine vitamin'
item.description: A new University of Chicago, is the first to show higher rates of COVID-19 in people who were recently vitamin-D deficient - within the year - before getting tested for coronavirus.

item.title: TOM UTLEY: I fear it's my fault Apple's outstripped the whole FTSE 100
item.description: TOM UTLEY: I blame Barbara for initiating me into the cult of Apple and sparking an addiction I've been unable to shake off since. She took one look at my old mobile phone and shook her head.

item.title: Joe Biden says he spoke to Jacob Blake for 15 minutes
item.description: Joe Biden said Thursday in Kenosha, Wisconsin that he was able to talk to Jacob Blake, the black man shot by a white officer in the city, by phone as he gathered with family members in Milwaukee.

item.title: Yes, be big and beautiful, but I know the cost that comes later
item.description: ALICE DOGRUYOL: I've read that you are a size 18, while at your age I was a slightly slimmer size 16. However, the weight can really creep on as you get older, as happened with me.

item.title: Dietitian reveals why your 'healthy' breakfast choices might be making you put on weight
item.description: A dietitian has revealed why you shouldn't demonise carbohydrates and particularly bread when you're on a healthy diet. Savina from Perth said bread is often healthier than cereal.

item.title: Porcelain bowl that was used to hold foliage for years is expected to sell for a fortune
item.description: This porcelain bowl is tipped to sell for £15,000 after it emerged it was made for a Chinese emperor. Unaware of the antique's significance, its owner had tried to sell it on eBay for £200.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES watches Liz Truss face a barrage of hysteria in the Commons
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Whenever there's a session of International Trade questions, the chamber takes on a whisky sour flavour.

item.title: Tim Davie says BBC is 'no place' for 'opinionated columnists'
item.description: The BBC's new Director-General has warned staff who want to be opinionated columnists or woke online campaigners 'You should not be working here' in fiery first speech in charge

item.title: Number of properties selling within a week of hitting the market reaches highest level for a DECADE
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak's decision to scrap the levy on properties worth up to £500,000 has helped to fire up the housing market, according to Rightmove, which analysed more than 200,000 properties.

item.title: Amanda Holden 'is promoted to head judge on BGT to fill in for Simon Cowell'
item.description: The presenter, 49, will take the prominent position on the judging panel for the semi-finals beginning this weekend, and joked she'd back 'musical theatre all the way,' if she had to make a deciding vote.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: The Dragon School drops name of Gunga Din boarding house
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Rudyard Kipling's accomplishments appear to count for little in 21st-century Britain. The Dragon School has decided to change the name of a boarding house.

item.title: Facebook will pay users to deactivate accounts weeks ahead of the US presidential election
item.description: Facebook is embarking on a journey to see how social media impacts democracy and as part of its study, the firm will pay users to deactivate their accounts for weeks before the presidential election.

item.title: The UK is being strangled... as rivals steal our business, writes Heathrow Airport Chief Executive
item.description: JOHN HOLLAND-KAY, Heathrow Airport Chief Executive, calls for testing to be done at airports to reduce quarantine times and allow for international travel to restart.

item.title: Student tricks AI grading system into giving a perfect score by adding 'word salad' to answers
item.description: Students are exploiting a flaw in the grading algorithm used by Edgenuity, an online learning program. Adding a jumble of keywords to their answers practically ensures a perfect score

item.title: Karen Matthews' best friend says anonymity order for Shannon 'will help her'
item.description: Julie Bushby (pictured), from Huddersfield, whose evidence helped convict Karen, said 'those kids need to try and have a normal life', 12 years after the staged disappearance.

item.title: Second grader shows of bottle of Malibu rum for show and tell on Zoom
item.description: Meghan Maza Oeser from Illinois, shared a photo of her daughter Penny attending class on Zoom. She was showing her class 'something that smells good' - a bottle of Malibu rum.

item.title: Robert Pattinson 'tests POSITIVE for COVID-19 forcing The Batman to halt filming'
item.description: Sources told Vanity Fair that the actor, 34, has contracted the deadly virus just days after production resumed on the big-budget film.

item.title: Passengers rushed to hospital after 17 injured when world's last ocean-going paddle steamer crashes
item.description: The Waverley paddle steamer crashed near the Brodick ferry terminal in Scotland at around 5.15pm. A coastguard search and rescue helicopter has been sent to the scene.

item.title: Copper can kill coronavirus and bring a glow to your home
item.description: Few know about the medical benefits of the metal. So, whether you're after new fixtures and fittings or a showstopping bath tub, here's how to incorporate copper in your home.

item.title: Beirut blast rescuers 'detect heartbeat' under rubble sparking hopes of finding survivor
item.description: A pulsing signal was detected on Thursday from under the rubble of a building that collapsed during the horrific port explosion on August 4 after a sniffer dog detected something.

item.title: Tory panic as poll finds Covid crisis has poisoned public's view of the PM
item.description: MPs warned that the situation could not be allowed to continue, with fears aides are obsessed with 'gimmicks' rather than governing and contriving to made a difficult situation even worse.

item.title: Commentator and interviewer Iain Dale highlights the bitter divisions in British society
item.description: Why Can't We All Just Get Along... is Iain Dale's latest book. The book highlights how Theresa May was once told by a Tory MP to 'bring her own noose' and another warned she would be 'dead soon'.

item.title: Why is a new biography reluctant to explore the painter Lucian Freud's priapic excesses?
item.description: The Lives of Lucian Freud: Fame, 1968-2011, is by William Feaver and is the second volume of his biography of the great painter.

item.title: One royal wedding, seven musical stars and a VERY driven mother: Memoir reveals commitment required
item.description: In her memoir, House of Music, Dr Kadiatu Kanneh-Mason - mother to Cellist Sheku Kanneh-Mason and six other musicians - reveals trials of her disciplined parenting.

item.title: RAF Typhoons to receive major radar upgrade
item.description: The RAF Typhoons will be fitted with the £317million radar system which is due to be operational by the mid-2020s. The European Common Radar System Mark 2 could save 600 British jobs.

item.title: Jane Fonda calls Marlon Brando 'disappointing' and says she regrets never sleeping with Marvin Gaye
item.description: Fonda, 82, dished dirt during a quick round of 'Confirm or Deny' questions, where she said she wasn't exactly charmed by the Wild One talent, who was her co-star in 1966's The Chase.

item.title: Meghan Markle sues picture agency over photos of her walking with son Archie in a park
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex has taken a news and picture agency to the High Court over pictures of her and her son Archie in a Canadian park. None of the pictures showed the boy's face

item.title: Manchester cleaner blew £31,000 after shop staff accidentally transferred £90,000 into her bank
item.description: Comfort Konadu (pictured), 52, from Manchester, admitted theft and was sentenced to 15 months in prison, suspended for two years at the city's crown court.

item.title: Pride and Prejudice fans enjoy 6ft tall cake version of Colin Firth as Mr Darcy
item.description: The life-sized cake of Mr Darcy has been created to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the BBC mini-series and was unveiled at the National Trust property Lyme Park, in Cheshire.

item.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX completes its SECOND Starship 'hop' with another prototype
item.description: SpaceX completed the second 'hop' of its Starship rocket Thursday at its facility in Boca Chica, Texas - bringing the firm one-step closer to sending humans to Mars.

item.title: Study finds it is nearly impossible not to move along to music
item.description: Researchers in Norway measured the micro-movements of people when music was played and found it was virtually impossible for them to stand completely still. EDM had the biggest effect.

item.title: Girl, three, dies and female passenger, 17, is left fighting for life after Peugeot and van collide
item.description: A three-year-old girl died in a collision after emergency services, including air ambulances, rushed to the scene on the Coast Road in Horden, County Durham at around 2.30pm on Wednesday.

item.title: 'Selfish and irresponsible' organisers of massive house party face police probe after 300 turn up
item.description: Around 300 'selfish and irresponsible' party-goers attended a gathering at Mansion House of Kirkhill in Midlothian on Saturday. A 27-year-old man was fined, but police have launched a new probe.
item.media:credit: The Mansion House of Kirkhill / Airbnb

item.title: Fury over new Tesco charity promotion
item.description: Shopper Jamie Holtom from Cheltenham was outraged after her partner was charged 80p more for a product she bought on the same day in the same store after the bill was rounded up for charity.

item.title: WWII scrapbook photos shows Japanese officer's surrender
item.description: Dave Reyes first stumbled across the black-and-white September 11, 1945 images showing Japan surrendering to Australia when he was just seven years old and he released them on Wednesday.

item.title: Mileage limit set at 75 for test and trace appointments as success rate plunges to worst levels yet
item.description: Test and trace boss Dido Harding has installed a 75-mile limit on travelling to appointments after it was revealed some patients were being asked to drive almost 300 miles

item.title: Now for the PURPLE bin: Confused householders get new container for their paper and cardboard
item.description: More residents in Lincolnshire will now get another bin just for paper and card waste. They already use a bin or bag for plastic, another one for garden waste and another one for home waste

item.title: Officer is charged with voluntary manslaughter over the shooting death of black man inside a Walmart
item.description: San Leandro police officer Jason Fletcher, 49, top inset was charged on Wednesday. Steven Taylor, 33, bottom inset was shot dead in April in a San Francisco Bay Area Walmart, main,

item.title: Wealthy heiress' collection including 500 pairs of shoes is sold after her death aged 89
item.description: Jenny Simpson, who inherited a large family fortune, was known to splash the cash in big cities but was 'devoted to her home town' of Aldeburgh, Suffolk, where she lived for 30 years.

item.title: Viral TikTok star famous for 'angry reactions' reveals he is homeless
item.description: Oneya Johnson, a 22-year-old who lives in his car in Lafayette, Indiana, earned one million followers in just 24 hours thanks to his brilliant videos.

item.title: Council tells furious tenants repainting their houses colour of 'baby poo' will help save the planet
item.description: Hounslow Council claims that by painting the houses the colour reminiscent of a baby's nappy, residents were actually saving more than £300 a year through energy efficiencies.

item.title: Astronomers find first evidence of a 'twisted' planet-forming disc
item.description: Experts from the University of Exeter used a number of instruments including the European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope to make the discovery.

item.title: A supersonic Air Force One? Pentagon asks firm to draw up plans for new Mach 1.8 presidential plane
item.description: The Air Force has awarded a 24-month, $1million contract to Exosonic, a start-up aerospace company that is developing a 70-seat, passenger aircraft that can fly at Mach 1.8 speeds.

item.title: Back to normal by Christmas? Hancock says rapid testing is 'best shot' at ending social distancing
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock said this morning that new technologies that can detect Covid-19 in people's saliva on the spot are Britain's 'best shot' at getting out of its current social distancing rules.

item.title: 'Beautiful and inspiring' mental health student nurse dies just days before her 27th birthday
item.description: Bronwen Morgan, of Cyncoed, Cardiff, died in hospital after being taken from a hotel. South Wales Police are investigating her death but it is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: 400 people apply to live in four eco-homes on Isle of Rum twenty miles off Scotland's west coast
item.description: The Isle of Rum, Inner Hebrides, put out a call for tenants to join the population of around just 30 people after building four new two-bedroom eco homes.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN presents a hilarious sneak preview of Meghan and Harry's Netflix deal
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: Meghan and Harry have inspired me to now cast a crystal ball and look into the future to imagine the kind of hyper-woke productions on Netflix from Megxit Productions.

item.title: Michel Barnier delivers ultimatum on post-Brexit fishing rights
item.description: The EU wants to secure continued access to UK waters for the bloc's fishing boats but Number 10 is adamant that British trawlers will be given priority.

item.title: Explorer yacht Ragnar hits the rental market for $525k a week - and it has a helipad and spa
item.description: The yacht, called Ragnar, underwent a 22-month makeover from an offshore supply vessel to a sleek pleasure cruiser. The Dutch-built vessel, which sleeps 12 people, is now available to rent.

item.title: Man is shot dead by DC police as BLM protesters say 'we're on our way'
item.description: The shooting happened Wednesday afternoon and comes amid nationwide unrest over police violence; the victim has been named Deon Kay, 18.

item.title: Wear a mask while having sex but don't kiss, Canada's top doctor says
item.description: Dr Theresa Tam, Chief Public Health Officer of Canada, also suggests monitoring yourself and your partner for symptoms and being aware if your partner is at high risk of contracting COVID-19.

item.title: Female bodybuilder slams men who 'sneer' at her muscles and say they're a turn off
item.description: Wendy Fortino, 37, from Oceanside, California, has always been in great shape; when she was just 10 years old, boys would challenge her to arm wrestles - which she always won.

item.title: BBC journalist 'uses anonymous Twitter account to troll Jewish Radio 5 Live presenter Emma Barnett'
item.description: Nimesh Thaker is accused of using a Twitter account to support attacks against BBC Radio 5 Live presenter Emma Barnett following rapper Wiley's anti-Semitic outburst in July.

item.title: Humans have only been able to digest milk as adults for a few thousand years
item.description: Experts from the Johannes Gutenberg University, studied the remains of Bronze Age warriors that were slain in 1200 BC on a river bank in what is now Germany.

item.title: Duncan Bannatyne's wife Nigora Whitehorn slams 'filthy and disgusting' three star hotel in Italy
item.description: Duncan Bannatyne's glamorous wife Nigora Whitehorn refused to stay at a luxury three star hotel in Italy after branding the accommodation 'filthy and disgusting.'

item.title: Kent Airbnb hosts banned anyone who weighs more than 16st from staying at their cottage
item.description: Hosts Zsu and Marcus were slammed for a weight restriction on visitors to their cottage Bobbit's Lair in Sandwich, Kent, which they later updated claiming it was due to 'very old oak beams'.
